newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss purchasing index shows industrial expansion.
newsitem.headline: Swiss purchasing index shows industrial expansion.

text.p: The Swiss Purchasing managers' index (PMI) rose to 51.2 percent from a revised 44.2 percent in December, the first time since February 1996 the PMI indicated a slight expansion in Swiss industry.

The improvement in the index, which is compiled by Credit Suisse and the Swiss Association for Material Management and Purchasing (SVME), is mainly due to rises in the sub-indicies for production and order levels.
Apart from the employment index, all sub-indicies rose with production, orders-on-hand, purchasing volume and purchasing prices rising above the critical 50 percent level.
The production index, which showed the strongest rise, was partially due to a higher number of working days. An increase in purchasing prices was also affected by the weaker Swiss franc.
The Swiss PMI, published since September 1995, is based on surveys in which companies are asked to rate each sub-index as higher, lower or unchanged from the month before.
